sub_title: Senior Consultant - Life Sciences Commercial Strategy |  Public Health Professional | Passionate about Innovation in Life Sciences|
summary:
Life Sciences | Pharmaceutical Industry | Commercial Strategy | Brand Planning | Launch Readiness & Excellence | Product Lifecyle Management | Healthcare Innovation | 

Everyone has the right to health. I dedicated my ideas and strength to achieve this goal. 

As Senior Consultant I support pharmaceutical and biotech companies in identifying and overcoming market barriers throughout the product life cycle as well as developing commercialization models (go-to-market models & operating models) to support the product launch and commercialization of innovative therapies / products. 

Before working as a life science consultant, I did my PhD in Public Health as part of a large EU funded project. The main focus of my PhD was to analyse why innovations in healthcare and ICT often fail to reach the market by ending in the Death Valley of innovations and how we can overcome the valley of death. Working as a life science consultant allows me to apply my thorough theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios. 


✔️Secured >5 Million Euros in non-dilutive funding for life science companies and researchers 
✔️Supported >50 clients including pharmaceutical and medical device companies and clinical key opinion 
     leaders in advancing their clinical development plan as well as developing their commercialization and 
     business development strategies
✔️Strong theoretical background in European Public Health, Health Policy, Healthcare Systems and    
     Innovation in Healthcare
✔️Willing to go the extra mile to help clients to overcome market barriers and to bring innovations to the 
     market to change the lives of millions of people

projects: [{'title': 'innXchange', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': "InnXchange is a European-African project within the scope of the ERA-Net ‘ERAfrica’ (www.erafrica.eu). The aim of innXchange is to increase innovation potential with regard to 'Personalized Medicine' and 'Mobile Health' by European-African cooperation. InnXchange is a partnership between European and African countries to learn from each other’s experience how to increase the efficiency of innovation processes\n Institutions from The Netherlands and Germany joined with partners from South Africa and Kenya to compare existing innovation systems in their diversity in economics, society, culture and history regarding 'Personalized Medicine' and 'Mobile Health'. Using a comparative approach, the partners study how innovative ideas are generated in each country, and how new ideas are translated into practice. The objectives of the project are the following: 1) Determine the state of the art with regards to innovation management at the participating institutions with emphasis on the similarities and differences of the European African approaches; 2) Conduct “Innovation Camps” in each of the participating countries, with the aim to create an initial set of guidelines taking into account country differences, cultural and contextual relevance; 3) Conduct an “Innovation Creator” during which the initial guidelines will be evaluated by using existing patents to create innovative solutions for solving a real challenge; 4) Preparation of a roadmap for future research. A set of guidelines will be composed with the best practical approaches from each partner country providing recommendations how these principles help to optimize entrepreneurial cooperation, and education and training in the partner countries. The innXchange project will also demonstrate how a cooperation between European and African partners can be an inspiration for innovations and entrepreneurial activities.\n", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sebastian', 'last_name': 'Schee genannt Halfmann, PhD', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Consultant - Life Sciences Commercial Strategy |  Public Health Professional | Passionate about Innovation in Life Sciences|'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Angela', 'last_name': 'Brand', 'name': None, 'headline': 's. - Engaging with policy makers, key opinion leaders and other relevant stakeholders 
- Conducting research focusing on social and technological innovation in health care systems in Europe 
    and beyond
- Organisation of project workshops and high-level conferences; 
- Managing the projects agenda and coordinating the project communication; 
- Presenting the project results at workshops and conferences; 
- Writing annual reports, workshop & conference minutes and scientific articles 

Beside my tasks as Project Manger i conducted research focusing on social and technological innovation in healthcare systems in Europe and beyond.

To provide systematic guidance on the essential steps of the innovation process, the project “Increasing innovation potential by European-African cooperation” (innXchange) was initiated. The project was initially funded by the ERA-net ERAfrica from 2014 until 2016. It aimed at capacity building for innovation creation and management in African (South Africa, Kenya) and European partner institutions (Germany, The Netherlands). The unique and new approach in innXchange was to compare countries from the African Union with countries from the European Union to gain new insights into existing innovation systems by exchanging perspectives and comparing the state-of-the-art of existing innovation approaches on two different continents. Differences which exist between African and 
European countries as to how innovations are created and managed were identified.
